articles.title: Withdrawal of "university restructuring" called for
articles.content:
Sports and amusement games held
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Builders of the capital city held multifarious sports and amusement games at the East Pyongyang Stadium on May 2 to commemorate May Day.
   The stadium was packed with tens of thousands of working people from more than 200 factories and enterprises under the associated capital construction bureau. 
   They competed in 16 sports and amusement events, including basketball, football, volleyball, wrestling, mass rhythmic exercise, Taekwon-do physical exercise and group forced march.
  They fully demonstrated the noble spirit of collectivism, strong will and sports skills.

articles.title: Intellectuals contribute to building powerful  nation
articles.content:
Withdrawal of "university restructuring" called for
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The National University Trade Union under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) rejected the authorities' "university restructuring" on April 27, according to a report.
   More than 700 unionists from 64 branch organizations from across South Korea held a rally and marched through streets.
   After criticizing the authorities for ignoring their repeated demands, they declared that they would join KCTU in the May struggle unless the authorities show a sincere attitude.

articles.title: U.S. keen on preparations for war against DPRK
Curses come home to roost
articles.content:
U.S. keen on preparations for war against DPRK
       Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Defense Department in a report submitted to the congress on April 29 advocated the building of the "Theatre Missile Defense" system (TMD) in Japan and South Korea on the pretext of "coping with missile attack from North Korea", according to a report.
   The U.S. development and deployment of TMD is a criminal move to increase the capacity of missile attack on Korea and round off the preparations for a war against the DPRK.
   This move of the U.S. is stirring up public concern and denunciation as it is fraught with the danger of mounting military tensions and arms race in northeast Asia.

articles.title: Greetings to Polish President
"Combined use of Chinese characters" rejected
articles.content:
Greetings to Polish President 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings  to Polish President Aleksander Kwasniewski on April 30 on the occasion of the constitution day, the national holiday of the Polish people.
   The message sent felicitations to the President and the Polish people and wished him success in his work on the day.

articles.title: KPA Supreme Commander praised
articles.content:
"Combined use of Chinese characters" rejected
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- South Korean publications continue carrying articles rejecting the authorities' sycophantic treacherous moves for "the combined use of Chinese characters" and obliteration of the Korean language.
   The newspaper Hangyore said in an article titled "start of signature campaign to defend our mother tongue" that organizations related to the Korean written language have launched a massive signature campaign against the call for the combined use of Chinese characters.
   In another article headlined "article to people" it said the Policy of spoken and written language should not be decided upon by power or money.
   The magazine mal described the South Korean reality in which foreign language and mixed language are rampant as a "fair of phrases in vogue".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on CPRF's calls
Talks between DPRK and Sudanese government delegations
Agreement on mutual cooperation signed between DPRK and Sudan
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Sudanese government delegations
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Talks between the DPRK government delegation and the Sudanese government delegation were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
   At the talks, the sides exchanged views on strengthening the friendly relations between the two countries and a series of matters of common concern. 
Present there on the DPRK side were Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun and other officials concerned,  and on the opposite side were the members of the Sudanese government delegation led by Mustafa Osman Ismail, Foreign Minister. 
   The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Greetings to Cote d'Ivoire President
articles.content:
Agreement on mutual cooperation signed between DPRK and Sudan
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation between the foreign ministries of the DPRK and the Republic of Sudan was signed here today.
Paek Nam Sun, DPRK Foreign Minister, and Mustafa Osman Ismail, Sudanese  Foreign Minister who is leading the Sudanese government delegation, signed the agreement.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets Sudanese government delegation
articles.content:
Greetings to Cote d'Ivoire President
   Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK today sent a message of greetings to Henri Konan Bedie, President of Cote d'Ivoire, on his 65th birthday.
   The message congratulated him on his birthday and wished him good health and happiness and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further strengthen and develop.
